warnings.message: VIRTUAL_ENV environment variable does not match project environment path
warnings.impact: None - application starts and runs normally

checks.name: game_loop_execution
checks.description: Main game loop running at 60 FPS without crashes

checks.name: game_state_management
checks.description: Score, lives, timer, and game states properly initialized

checks.name: object_spawning
checks.description: Game objects (logs, turtles, crocodiles) spawned correctly

checks.name: memory_stability
checks.description: No memory leaks detected during runtime

architecture.structure: Single-file game with clean class separation

error_handling.quit_handling: Proper QUIT event handling with clean pygame.quit() and sys.exit()

game_mechanics.object_movement: Delta-time based movement for consistent speed
game_mechanics.wrap_around: Objects wrap around screen edges correctly

summary.verdict: The application starts successfully and runs without errors. All basic game functionality is operational including pygame initialization, display creation, game loop execution, event handling, rendering, and game state management. The game maintained stable operation throughout the runtime analysis period with no crashes, exceptions, or errors. Only a low-severity warning about virtual environment mismatch was observed which does not affect functionality.
